column4: <JoseStefan>, say for a test folder, what would I put into terminal?
it's chmod perm file if you just want to set it
you hvae to go to the website to paste
then you paste the url here
you should remvoe the packages, not just the files.  And remember to do it all with --purge (or "complete removal" in synaptic)
in synaptic?  You flag them for "complete removal" as opposed to just "removal"
right click on the little box thing, and choose c.r.
on which package?  There's more than one that make up kde.  the .desktop file is in either kdebase-data or ksmserver, completely remove both of those, and you should have kde no longer in sessions.
at a terminal, (close synaptic), `sudo apt-get remove --purge kdebase-data ksmserver`  I'm assuming the file is kde.desktop, but I don't know for sure.
if you could give me an exact filename, we can figure out what package it came from
install ntfs-config, and there'll be a menu entry for it
once you install it, there should be a menu entry in administration
